info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 6:46PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...HAZARDOUS SHOWERS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EASTERN LAKE MARION... ...MARINERS SHOULD SEE SAFE HARBOR... At 645 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated an areas of hazardous showers near Elloree, or 15 nm east of Brookdale, moving southeast at 20 knots. HAZARD...gusty winds 30 to 40 knots. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect briefly stronger winds and suddenly higher waves. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: Boaters on the eastern portions of Lake Marion should seek safe harbor immediately. If caught on the open water, stay as low as possible and wear a personal flotation device. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
